abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Chad Petroleum Sector
            Management Capacity Building Project were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was substantial, the Bank performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1) need
            for a proper policy environment and a strong commitment by
            the highest authorities; 2) building realistic expectations
            as to the results that can be achieved with this type of
            projects, and the time frame for achieving them is a key
            element for securing the continued support of the
            stakeholders; 3) flexibility should be sought in the
            implementation of training programs designed to respond to
            immediate needs, and to develop a wider knowledge base for
            the creation of the human capital needed to develop the
            sector; and 4) continuity of the team working on the project
            is very important both for the Bank and the Borrower.
